Datum.Description: CCSDS Time from spacecraft bus housekeeping packet (point to point telemetry) expressed as TAI58 (IET)
Temperature inside PT&C A unit
Temperature inside PT&C B unit
Temperature on SARR Baseplate, between PT&C and Tx/Rx sub-assemblies (RT2)
Temperature on SARR Baseplate, between PT&C and Tx/Rx sub-assemblies (RT4)
Status of the PPC latching relay for PT&C A (changed by PPC1 and PPC3)
Status of the PPC latching relay for PT&C B (changed by PPC2 and PPC4)
CCSDS Time from SARR Housekeeping Packet expressed as TAI58 (IET)
PDS Enable/Disable - Indicates if the PDS channel in selected PT&C is on or off
PDS 1dB Attenuator - Indicates if the 1 dB pad in the active PDS channel is on (1 dB) or off (0 dB)
PDS 2dB Attenuator - Indicates if the 2 dB pad in the active PDS channel is on (2 dB) or off (0 dB)
PDS 4dB Attenuator - Indicates if the 4 dB pad in the active PDS channel is on (4 dB) or off (0 dB)
PDS 8dB Attenuator - Indicates if the 8 dB pad in the active PDS channel is on (8 dB) or off (0 dB)
Rx Redundancy RF Switch - Indicates if the Rx RF Switch is connected to Rx A or Rx B
Rx A On/Off - Indicates if Rx A is active or not
Rx B On/Off - Indicates if Rx B is active or not
Rx AGC Enabled/Disabled - Indicates if the active Rx is in AGC mode or in Fix Gain
Rx Freq Generator Lock - Indicates if the active Rx FG is locked or out-of-lock
Rx 1dB Attenuator - Indicates if the 1 dB pad in the active Rx is on (1 dB) or off (0 dB)
Rx 2dB Attenuator - Indicates if the 2 dB pad in the active Rx is on (2 dB) or off (0 dB)
Rx 4dB Attenuator - Indicates if the 4 dB pad in the active Rx is on (4 dB) or off (0 dB)
Rx 8dB Attenuator - Indicates if the 8 dB pad in the active Rx is on (8 dB) or off (0 dB)
Tx Redundancy RF Switch - Indicates if the Tx RF switch is connected to Tx A or to Tx B
Tx On/Off - Indicates if Tx is on or off (Tx A if PT&C A is selected, Tx B if PT&C B is selected)
Tx Freq Generator Lock - Indicates if Tx FG is locked or out-of-lock (Tx A if PT&C A is selected, Tx B if PT&C B is selected)
Tx Driver FET Gate Voltage of the active Tx
Tx Driver FET Drain Voltage of the active Tx
Tx Output FET Gate voltage of the active Tx
Tx Output FET Drain voltage of the active Tx
Tx Output FET Temperature of the active Tx
Tx RF output power of the active Tx
Tx USO oven temperature of the active Tx
Tx ALC voltage of the active Tx
Rx gain voltage of Rx A, in either Fix Gain or AGC, when it is active.
Rx gain voltage of Rx B, in either Fix Gain or AGC, when it is active
Rx A USO oven temperature when it is active
Rx B USO oven temperature when it is active
Rx A Unit temperature. Also valid when Rx A is OFF
Rx B Unit temperature. Also valid when Rx B is OFF.
PT&C EPC input current drawn by the +28V EPC of the active PT&C from the spacecraft
Rx EPC input current drawn by the Rx EPC located inside the active PT&C
Tx EPC input current drawn by the Tx EPC located inside the active PT&C
AT18 +28V Main Bus Voltage - The +28V input bus voltage from the spacecraft to the active PT&C
PT&C EPC +28V Reg. Voltage - Internally regulated +28V volt from the active PT&C
Tx EPC +9V output voltage from the Tx EPC that is used to drive Tx RF circuits
Tx EPC +8V output voltage from the Tx EPC that is used to drive Tx RF circuits
Tx EPC –8V output voltage from the Tx EPC that is used to drive Tx RF circuits
Tx EPC +15V (FG) Output Voltage from the Tx EPC that is used to drive Tx FG circuits
Tx EPC +15V (USO) output voltage that is used to drive Tx USO circuits including the crystal oven
Rx EPC +8V output voltage from the Rx EPC that is used to drive RF circuits in either RxA or RxB, as selected.
Rx EPC –8V output voltage from the Rx EPC that is used to drive RF circuits in either RxA or RxB, as selected
Rx EPC +15V (FG) output voltage from the Rx EPC that is used to drive FG circuits in either RxA or RxB, as selected
Rx EPC +15V (USO) output voltage from the Rx EPC that is used to drive USO circuits including the crystal oven, in either RxA or RxB, as selected
Thermistor Ref. voltage used for all 1553 temperature measurement within the SARR
Tx EPC temperature at Tx EPC inside the corresponding PT&C
SARR baseplate temperature between PT&C(s) and Tx/Rx sub-assemblies (Refer to RT1 & RT3)
